SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:59>)
web_search("Israeli airstrike Gaza July 2024")
```

## Web Sources
**Reverse Search Result** The exact image was found in the following sources:

From [Source](https://english.enabbaladi.net/archives/2023/03/shams-journey-from-under-the-rubble-to-abu-dhabis-burjeel-hospital/): Found exact image on website with title: Sham's journey from under the rubble to Abu Dhabi's Burjeel Hospital
Content: The image is of a Syrian child, Sham, who was rescued from the rubble in Armanaz, Idlib, after an earthquake on February 7, 2023. The child was later transferred to hospitals in Turkey and Abu Dhabi for treatment. The article is from Enab Baladi, an independent Syrian media organization. <image:4663>, <image:4664>.


From [Source](https://uaetimes.ae/shams-journey-from-under-the-rubble-to-abu-dhabis-burjeel-hospital/): Found exact image on website with title: Sham's journey from under the rubble to Abu Dhabi's Burjeel Hospital
Content: The search result is from UAE Times, published on March 14, 2023. It discusses the journey of a Syrian child, Sham, who was rescued from the rubble after an earthquake in February 2023. The article mentions that Sham was transferred to Abu Dhabi's Burjeel Hospital for treatment. The image <image:59> is found in the article. The article also mentions that the child was rescued on February 7, 40 hours after an earthquake struck southern Turkey and four Syrian provinces.


From [Source](https://english.elpais.com/international/2023-07-20/the-manual-of-repression-shared-by-modern-tyrants.html): Found exact image on website with title: The 'manual of repression' shared by modern tyrants | International
Content: The article from El PaÃ­s, published on July 20, 2023, discusses how modern tyrants share tactics of repression. The article includes an image <image:4699> of a screen showing a girl trapped in rubble and a video call with Asma al-Assad. The article also includes the image <image:59> of a child in rubble.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:59>)
web_search("Israeli airstrike Gaza July 2024")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13_July_2024_al-Mawasi_attack): 
Content: "[Jump to content](#bodyContent)

| Date | 13 July 2024 |
| Target | [Mohammed Deif](/wiki/Mohammed_Deif "Mohammed Deif")<br> and [Rafa Salama](/wiki/Rafa_Salama "Rafa Salama") |

| Weapons | Eight [2,000-pound bombs](/wiki/Mark_84_bomb "Mark 84 bomb")<br>, [missiles](/wiki/Missiles "Missiles") |
| Deaths | 90+ Palestinians |
| Injured | 300+ Palestinians |

attacks](/wiki/Israeli_attacks_on_Yemen_(May_2025%E2%80%93present) "Israeli attacks on Yemen (May 2025â€“present)")<br>    <br><br>[Attacks on US bases](/wiki/Attacks_on_US_bases_during_the_Gaza_war "Attacks on US bases during the Gaza war")<br><br>*   [Iranian airstrikes in Iraq and Syria](/wiki/2024_Iranian_missile_strikes_in_Iraq_and_Syria "2024 Iranian missile strikes in Iraq and Syria")<br>    <br>*   [Tower 22 drone attack](/wiki/Tower_22_drone_attack "Tower 22 drone attack")<br>    <br>*   [February 2024 US airstrikes in Iraq and ceasefire")<br>        <br><br>[Assassinations](/wiki/Executions_and_assassinations_during_the_Gaza_war "Executions and assassinations during the Gaza war")<br> and deaths of prominent individuals<br><br>*   [Saleh al-Arouri](/wiki/Assassination_of_Saleh_al-Arouri "Assassination of Saleh al-Arouri")<br>    <br>*   [Marwan Issa](/wiki/Assassination_of_Marwan_Issa "Assassination of Marwan Issa")<br>    <br>*   [Fuad Shukr](/wiki/Killing_of_Fuad_Shukr "Killing of Fuad Shukr")<br>    <br>*   [Ismail Haniyeh](/wiki/Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh "Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh")<br>    <br>*   [Ibrahim Aqil](/wiki/20_September_2024_Beirut_attack "20 September 2024 Beirut attack")<br>    <br>*   [Hassan Nasrallah](/wiki/2024_Hezbollah_headquarters_strike "2024 Hezbollah headquarters strike")<br>    <br>*   [Hashem Safieddine](/wiki/Assassination_of_Hashem_Safieddine "Assassination of Hashem Safieddine")<br>    <br>*   [Yahya Salami](/wiki/Hossein_Salami#Death "Hossein Salami")<br>    <br><br>* * *<br><br>See also<br><br>*   [Background](/wiki/Background_to_the_Gaza_war "Background to the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Antisemitism](/wiki/Antisemitism_during_the_Gaza_war "Antisemitism during the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Anti-Palestinianism](/wiki/Anti-Palestinianism_during_the_Gaza_war "Anti-Palestinianism during "Misinformation in the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Protests](/wiki/Gaza_war_protests "Gaza war protests")<br>    *   [university campuses](/wiki/2024_pro-Palestinian_protests_on_university_campuses "2024 pro-Palestinian protests on university campuses")<br>        <br>*   [All Eyes on Rafah](/wiki/All_Eyes_on_Rafah "All Eyes on Rafah")<br>    <br>*   [Israeli document leak scandal](/wiki/2024_Israeli_secret_document_leak_scandal "2024 Israeli secret document leak scandal")<br>    <br>*   [Israeli public diplomacy](/wiki/Israeli_public_diplomacy_in_the_Gaza_war "Israeli public diplomacy in the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Proposed U.S. takeover of the Gaza Strip](/wiki/Donald_Trump%27s_Gaza_Strip_proposal "Donald Trump's Gaza Strip proposal") |     |

On 13 July 2024, [Israeli](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 airstrikes hit the Al-Mawasi area near [Khan Yunis](/wiki/Khan_Yunis "Khan Yunis")
 in the [Gaza Strip](/wiki/Gaza_Strip "Gaza Strip")
 during the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
. The attack killed at least 90 [Palestinians](/wiki/Palestinians "Palestinians")
, among them women and children, and injured over 300.[\[1\]](#cite_note-:4-1)
[\[2\]](#cite_note-auto-2)
[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
 Israel said that the strike targeted [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")
 top leaders.[\[4\]](#cite_note-:7-4)
 Survivors reported that they were targeted without warning in an area they were told was safe.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

Following the [Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip](/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_the_Gaza_Strip "Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip")
, Israel ordered Palestinian civilians there to [evacuate](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_evacuations "Gaza Strip evacuations")
 to designated humanitarian safe zones, including Al-Mawasi in December 2023.[\[6\]](#cite_note-ToI-6)
 During the attack on 13 July 2024, Israel dropped eight 2,000-pound bombs on al-Mawasi, at least one of which was manufactured in the [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States")
.[\[7\]](#cite_note-WSJ1-7)
 Israel said that it had targeted and killed the military commander of [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")
, [Mohammed Deif](/wiki/Mohammed_Deif "Mohammed Deif")
, as well as Commander of the Hamas Khan Younis Brigade, [Rafa Salama](/wiki/Rafa_Salama "Rafa Salama")
.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)
 Hamas confirmed Deif's death on 30 January 2025.[\[4\]](#cite_note-:7-4)
[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)
[\[10\]](#cite_note-:18-10)
[\[11\]](#cite_note-:10-11)

Following the airstrikes, Israeli quadcopter aircraft waited for the ambulance and civil defence teams and opened fire as soon as they arrived, according to eyewitnesses, a local journalist and the [Euro-Mediterranean Human Rights Monitor](/wiki/Euro-Mediterranean_Human_Rights_Monitor "Euro-Mediterranean Human Rights Monitor")
.[\[12\]](#cite_note-eum-12)
 Two members of the [Palestinian Civil Defence](/wiki/Palestinian_Civil_Defence "Palestinian Civil Defence")
 were killed by this attack.[\[13\]](#cite_note-aj11-13)

The Mawasi attack led to international condemnations of Israel from Arab countries, the [European Union](/wiki/European_Union "European Union")
 and the [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations")
.[\[14\]](#cite_note-14)
 The EU called for an independent investigation and accountability, describing the attack a possible [war crime](/wiki/War_crime "War crime")
.[\[15\]](#cite_note-eu1-15)

An arrest warrant was issued for [Mohammed Deif](/wiki/Mohammed_Deif "Mohammed Deif")
 by the [International Criminal Court](/wiki/International_Criminal_Court "International Criminal Court")
 (ICC) on 21 November 2024, alongside [Benjamin Netanyahu](/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu "Benjamin Netanyahu")
 and [Yoav Gallant](/wiki/Yoav_Gallant "Yoav Gallant")
.[\[16\]](#cite_note-Fance24_ICC-16)
[\[17\]](#cite_note-Reuters_ICC_22_November_2024-17)
 The court acknowledged that Deif's death has been reported but said there was less public evidence than there was for the death of [Yahya Sinwar](/wiki/Yahya_Sinwar "Yahya Sinwar")
 or [Ismail Haniyeh](/wiki/Ismail_Haniyeh "Ismail Haniyeh")
.[\[18\]](#cite_note-18)
 After Hamas confirmed Deif had been killed in the airstrike, the ICC cancelled the warrant in February 2025.[\[19\]](#cite_note-:11-19)

Background
----------

During the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
, many civilians in Gaza were ordered by Israel to [evacuate](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_evacuations "Gaza Strip evacuations")
 to humanitarian safe zones. 13 July 2024.

[Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")

Part of the [Gazaâ€“Israel conflict](/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_conflict "Gazaâ€“Israel conflict")
, the [Israeliâ€“Palestinian conflict](/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_conflict "Israeliâ€“Palestinian conflict")
, and the [Middle Eastern crisis (2023â€“present)](/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Middle Eastern crisis (2023â€“present)")

6 languages [Add topic](#) This is an obvious and clear confirmation from the Zionist government that it will continuing its war of extermination against our Palestinian people, through repeatedly and systematically targeting the defenceless displaced civilians in tents, shelters and residential neighbourhoods".[\[27\]](#cite_note-:1-27)
     The group made a statement on [Telegram](/wiki/Telegram_(software) "Telegram (software)")
     calling for the Palestinians of the [West Bank](/wiki/West_Bank "West Bank")
     and [East Jerusalem](/wiki/East_Jerusalem "East Jerusalem")
     to "mobilize" in response to the strike.[\[51\]](#cite_note-51)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/81/InfoboxPIJ.svg/40px-InfoboxPIJ.svg.png)[Palestinian Islamic Jihad](/wiki/Palestinian_Islamic_Jihad "Palestinian Islamic Jihad")
    : the movement condemned the attack, stating that "The horrific massacre committed by the Zionist entity in al-Mawasi near Khan Younis is an insistence on continuing the war of extermination against our people,"[\[52\]](#cite_note-52)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Flag_of_Palestine.svg/40px-Flag_of_Palestine.svg.png)[Palestinian Authority](/wiki/Palestinian_Authority "Palestinian Authority")
    *   Spokesman [Nabil Abu Rudeineh](/wiki/Nabil_Abu_Rudeineh "Nabil Abu Rudeineh")
         said that US bears responsibility for Israel's actions, and also stated that "The massacre in al-Mawasi is a continuation of the [genocidal war against our people](/wiki/Palestinian_genocide_accusation "Palestinian genocide accusation")
        ".[\[53\]](#cite_note-53)
        
    *   [Palestinian Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Palestine "Prime Minister of Palestine")
         [Mohammad Mustafa](/wiki/Mohammad_Mustafa_(politician) "Mohammad Mustafa (politician)")
         has condemned Israel's "genocidal crimes" in Gaza.[\[54\]](#cite_note-54)
        
    *   [Palestinian President](/wiki/President_of_Palestine "President of Palestine")
         [Mahmoud Abbas](/wiki/Mahmoud_Abbas "Mahmoud Abbas")
         has said that Israel and the US were responsible for the attack on al-Mawasi.[\[55\]](#cite_note-55)
        
*   **Protests:** Hundreds of Palestinian protested in the West Bank against Israel's attacks on Al-Mawasi and [Al-Shati camp which killed at least 22 people](/wiki/July_2024_al-Shati_refugee_camp_attack "July 2024 al-Shati refugee camp attack")
    , protests were held in the cities of [Ramallah](/wiki/Ramallah "Ramallah")
    , [Jenin](/wiki/Jenin "Jenin")
    , [Hebron](/wiki/Hebron "Hebron")
     and [Tubas](/wiki/Tubas_(city) "Tubas (city)")
    .[\[56\]](#cite_note-56)

     has called for "access to independent investigations and accountability".[\[15\]](#cite_note-eu1-15)
     Borrell further stated the attack represented a possible [war crime](/wiki/Israeli_war_crimes_in_the_Gaza_war "Israeli war crimes in the Gaza war")
    , stating, "Wars have limits enshrined in international law; end can't justify all means. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240717045401/https://www.france24.com/en/middle-east/20240714-hamas-says-gaza-ceasefire-talks-still-ongoing-claims-military-chief-survived-israeli-strike-on-camp)
     from the original on 17 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240721235936/https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/israeli-orchestrated-a-planned-massacre-claims-hamas-after-70-palestinians-killed-in-gaza/articleshow/111703175.cms)
     from the original on 21 July 2024."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the 13 July 2024 al-Mawasi attack in the Gaza Strip, where Israeli airstrikes killed at least 90 Palestinians and injured over 300. <image:59> The attack occurred during the Gaza war, targeting an area where civilians had been told was safe. The article mentions that Israel said the strike targeted Hamas leaders, and that the attack led to international condemnations. The EU called for an independent investigation and accountability, describing the attack a possible war crime.

At least 30 killed in an Israeli airstrike on a school in Gaza, Palestinian officials say
=========================================================================================

By Lucas Lilieholm, Abeer Salman, Ibrahim Dahman, Benjamin Brown, and Mohammad Al Sawalhi, CNN

4 min read

Updated 12:12 PM EDT, Sat July 27, 2024

[](mailto:?subject=CNN%20content%20share&body=Check%20out%20this%20article%3A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.cnn.com%2F2024%2F07%2F27%2Fmiddleeast%2Fisrael-gaza-deir-al-balah-school-intl "Share with email")

![Smoke rises during an Israeli strike in Deir el-Balah in the central Gaza Strip on July 27, 2024, amid the ongoing conflict between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas.](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/gettyimages-2163054712-copy.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_833,w_1480,c_fill)

Smoke rises during an Israeli strike in Deir el-Balah in the central Gaza Strip on July 27, 2024, amid the ongoing conflict between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas.

Bashar Taleb/AFP/Getty Images

CNN Â â€”Â 

At least 30 people have been killed and over 100 injured in an Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir-al Balah, central Gaza, where thousands were sheltering, Palestinian officials said.

The Israeli military said it had launched the strike in order to destroy a Hamas command and control center inside the compound.

Most of the victims from the school arriving to Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in the aftermath of the attack were women and children, according to Dr. Khalil Al-Daqran, a spokesperson for the hospital.

Footage filmed by CNN inside the hospital morgue showed dead bodies on the floor and people coming in to identify their loved ones, with children among the deceased.

The emergency room is seen to be overwhelmed by casualties and has no more space for patients.Â One young man was seen receiving medical treatment on the floor.

Most of those brought to the hospital with injuries are children, including one young boy who was receiving treatment and soon after died with the word â€œunidentifiedâ€ written on his stomach.

The strike came soon after Israeliâ€™s military issued fresh evacuation orders further south, in the city of Khan Younis, where Israel launched a fresh offensive earlier in the week which has killed dozens of Palestinians.

Residents in southern neighborhoods were told to leave after being warned that the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) would â€œforcefully operateâ€ in the area.

Bashar Taleb/AFP/Getty Images

Fighting has been ongoing on Gaza for months, and the renewed offensive shows Israelâ€™s challenges in achieving its goal of eliminating Hamas. It added that the location previously defined as a humanitarian area â€œwill be adjusted.â€

Al-Mawasi has come under repeated Israeli attacks, including a strike on July 14 which [reportedly](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/13/middleeast/mawasi-deif-israel-hamas-gaza-intl/index.html)
 killed 90 people and injured 300 more.

An eyewitness in Khan Younis told CNN that she was â€œwoken up by the screamsâ€ of people as they fled the area following the evacuation order, saying she heard explosions and saw flares in the sky.

Scenes filmed by CNN in Khan Younis show people fleeing by car, motorbike, and donkey cart with all of their belongings. At least 1,200 people were killed and more than 250 others abducted, according to Israeli authorities.

![A man squats next to a fire, as Palestinians flee the eastern part of Khan Younis, after orders by Israeli army to evacuate their neighborhoods, in Khan Younis, in the southern Gaza Strip, on July 22, 2024.](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/2024-07-22t230552z-1199657593-rc2f09aiu8a9-rtrmadp-3-israel-palestinians.jpg?q=w_1110,c_fill)

A man squats next to a fire, as Palestinians flee the eastern part of Khan Younis, after orders by Israeli army to evacuate their neighborhoods, in Khan Younis, in the southern Gaza Strip, on July 22, 2024.

Mohammed Salem/Reuters

Israeli military action in Gaza has since killed 39,258 Palestinians and injured another 90,589, according to the Ministry of Health there. As of early July, [nearly 2 million people](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/06/middleeast/palestinians-displaced-gaza-israel-intl/index.html)
 had been displaced in Gaza â€“ almost the entire population, according to figures from the UN.

Aid agencies working in Gaza have warned previously that new rounds of evacuation orders are making the delivery of emergency rations even more difficult.

â€œPeople in Gaza are exhausted, living in inhumane conditions, with no safety at all,â€ the UN Relief and Works Agency posted on X on Monday.

On Thursday, the IDF said it had recovered the bodies of five Israeli hostages the previous day from a tunnel in an area of Khan Younis which it had previously designated as a â€œhumanitarian area.â€

Despite the fighting, US and Israeli officials expressed optimism [this week](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/23/politics/gaza-ceasefire-prospects-netanyahu-congress/index.html)
 over the possibility of a ceasefire and hostage deal being reached.

US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Friday that the different parties areÂ â€œinside the 10-yard line and driving toward the goal line.â€

Negotiations are set to resume in Rome on Sunday, two sources familiar with the meeting told CNN.

The US team will be led by CIA Director Bill Burns, who will be joined by his counterparts from Qatar, Egypt, and Israel.

Israelâ€™s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was in Washington this week and met with the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee, Vice President Kamala Harris, who urged him to seal an agreement.

â€œAs I just told Prime Minister Netanyahu, it is time to get this deal done,â€ said Harris. Israel said that about 100 militants had been killed during recent fighting.

The United Nations estimated that about 150,000 people fled Khan Younis on Monday alone, intensifying pressure on meager supplies of food and water, and places to seek shelter.

Israel launched its military offensive in Gaza on October 7 after Hamas attacked southern Israel."

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/27/nx-s1-5054283/gaza-school-shelter-deaths-israeli-airstrike): 
Content: "Israel's military said it was targeting a Hamas command center.**

At least 30 dead in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike hits a school used as a shelter
===================================================================================

  

July 27, 202411:27 AM ET

ByÂ 

[The Associated Press](https://www.npr.org/people/101453150/the-associated-press)

  !Palestinians displaced by the Israeli air and ground offensive on the Gaza Strip flee from parts of Khan Younis on Saturday, following an evacuation order by the Israeli army to leave parts of the southern area of Gaza Strip's second largest city. The Israeli military said one of its aircraft attacked from the air as part of its activity in Nablus.

[!People are seen among rubble in the Jabalia refugee camp, northern Gaza Strip, on July 21, 2024. Accessibility links

*   [Skip to main content](#mainContent)
    
*   [Keyboard shortcuts for audio player](https://help.npr.org/contact/s/article?name=what-are-the-keyboard-shortcuts-for-using-the-npr-org-audio-player)
    

**At least 30 dead in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike hits a school used as a shelter** **The school, where thousands were sheltering, was being used by displaced Palestinians and the deaths included several children. **Abdel Kareem Hana/AP** ****hide caption****

****toggle caption****

Abdel Kareem Hana/AP

DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip â€” Israeli airstrikes hit a school being used by displaced Palestinians in central Gaza on Saturday, killing at least 30 people including several children, as the countryâ€™s negotiators prepared to meet international mediators to discuss a proposed cease-fire.

At least seven children and seven women were among the dead taken from the girls' school in Deir al-Balah to Al Aqsa Hospital. Israel's military said it targeted a Hamas command center used to direct attacks against Israeli troops and develop and store "large quantities of weapons.â€ Hamas in a statement called the militaryâ€™s claim false.

Civil defense workers in Gaza said thousands had been sheltering in the school, which also contained a medical site.

[!Vice President Harris speaks after meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in the vice president's ceremonial office in the Eisenhower Executive Office Building of the White House on July 25. to stand with Israel as war in Gaza nears 10th month](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/24/nx-s1-5049499/israel-benjamin-netanyahu-us-congress)

According to Israeli estimates, about 1.8 million Palestinians shelter in the zone after being uprooted multiple times during Israelâ€™s punishing air and ground campaign. "What happens is when people have these orders, they have very little time to move.â€

Farther north, Palestinians mourned seven killed by Israeli airstrikes overnight on Zawaida, in central Gaza. <image:12318>

Palestinians displaced by the Israeli air and ground offensive on the Gaza Strip flee from parts of Khan Younis on Saturday, following an evacuation order by the Israeli army to leave parts of the southern area of Gaza Strip's second largest city. <image:12319>](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/25/nx-s1-5048285/harris-gaza-war)

### [Middle East conflict](https://www.npr.org/series/1205445976/middle-east-crisis)

### [Harris says she 'will not be silent' about humanitarian toll in Gaza](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/25/nx-s1-5048285/harris-gaza-war)

Associated Press journalists saw a dead toddler in an ambulance and bodies covered with blankets. Israel expanded the zone in May to take in people fleeing the southernmost city of Rafah, where more than half of Gazaâ€™s population at the time had crowded.

Gaza Health Ministry officials said the evacuation orders had forced at least three health centers to stop providing care and compounded issues such as piled-up waste and shortages of supplies.

[!Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speaks during a memorial ceremony in Tel Aviv on June 18."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The NPR article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike that hit a school being used as a shelter in Gaza, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including children. <image:12318>, <image:12319>. The Israeli military stated it targeted a Hamas command center.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:59>)
web_search("Israeli airstrike Gaza July 2024")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13_July_2024_al-Mawasi_attack): 
Content: The Wikipedia article discusses the 13 July 2024 al-Mawasi attack in the Gaza Strip, where Israeli airstrikes killed at least 90 Palestinians and injured over 300. <image:59> The attack occurred during the Gaza war, targeting an area where civilians had been told was safe. The article mentions that Israel said the strike targeted Hamas leaders, and that the attack led to international condemnations. The EU called for an independent investigation and accountability, describing the attack a possible war crime.


From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/27/middleeast/israel-gaza-deir-al-balah-school-intl): 
Content: The CNN article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir-al Balah, central Gaza, where at least 30 people were killed. <image:59> The article includes images of the aftermath, including bodies at a hospital and people fleeing the area. The article also mentions the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas, and the displacement of Palestinians.


From [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/27/nx-s1-5054283/gaza-school-shelter-deaths-israeli-airstrike): 
Content: The NPR article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike that hit a school being used as a shelter in Gaza, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including children. <image:12318>, <image:12319>. The Israeli military stated it targeted a Hamas command center.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the 13 July 2024 al-Mawasi attack in the Gaza Strip, where Israeli airstrikes killed at least 90 Palestinians and injured over 300. <image:59> The CNN article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir-al Balah, central Gaza, where at least 30 people were killed. <image:59> The NPR article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike that hit a school being used as a shelter in Gaza, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including children. <image:12318>, <image:12319>

The articles can be found here: [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13_July_2024_al-Mawasi_attack), [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/27/middleeast/israel-gaza-deir-al-balah-school-intl), [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/27/nx-s1-5054283/gaza-school-shelter-deaths-israeli-airstrike).

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:59>)
web_search("Israeli airstrike Gaza July 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:59>

### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article discusses the 13 July 2024 al-Mawasi attack in the Gaza Strip, where Israeli airstrikes killed at least 90 Palestinians and injured over 300. <image:59> The CNN article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir-al Balah, central Gaza, where at least 30 people were killed. <image:59> The NPR article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike that hit a school being used as a shelter in Gaza, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including children. <image:12318>, <image:12319>

The articles can be found here: [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13_July_2024_al-Mawasi_attack), [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/27/middleeast/israel-gaza-deir-al-balah-school-intl), [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/27/nx-s1-5054283/gaza-school-shelter-deaths-israeli-airstrike).


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that there were Israeli airstrikes in Gaza in July 2024. The search results mention attacks on July 13 and July 27, 2024. The image search did not provide any information about the image.

The claim states that the image shows a Palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024. While the evidence confirms Israeli airstrikes in Gaza during July 2024, it does not confirm the image's context.

Therefore, I cannot verify the claim. More information is needed to confirm the image's context.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

The articles can be found here: [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13_July_2024_al-Mawasi_attack), [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/27/middleeast/israel-gaza-deir-al-balah-school-intl), [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/27/nx-s1-5054283/gaza-school-shelter-deaths-israeli-airstrike).

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealandâ€™s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:59>)
web_search("Israeli airstrike Gaza July 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:59>

### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article discusses the 13 July 2024 al-Mawasi attack in the Gaza Strip, where Israeli airstrikes killed at least 90 Palestinians and injured over 300. <image:59> The CNN article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir-al Balah, central Gaza, where at least 30 people were killed. <image:59> The NPR article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike that hit a school being used as a shelter in Gaza, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including children. <image:12318>, <image:12319>

The articles can be found here: [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13_July_2024_al-Mawasi_attack), [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/27/middleeast/israel-gaza-deir-al-balah-school-intl), [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/27/nx-s1-5054283/gaza-school-shelter-deaths-israeli-airstrike).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there were Israeli airstrikes in Gaza in July 2024. The search results mention attacks on July 13 and July 27, 2024. The image search did not provide any information about the image.

The claim states that the image shows a Palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024. While the evidence confirms Israeli airstrikes in Gaza during July 2024, it does not confirm the image's context.

Therefore, I cannot verify the claim. More information is needed to confirm the image's context.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealandâ€™s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:59>)
web_search("Israeli airstrike Gaza July 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:59>

### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article discusses the 13 July 2024 al-Mawasi attack in the Gaza Strip, where Israeli airstrikes killed at least 90 Palestinians and injured over 300. <image:59> The CNN article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir-al Balah, central Gaza, where at least 30 people were killed. <image:59> The NPR article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike that hit a school being used as a shelter in Gaza, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including children. <image:12318>, <image:12319>

The articles can be found here: [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13_July_2024_al-Mawasi_attack), [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/27/middleeast/israel-gaza-deir-al-balah-school-intl), [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/27/nx-s1-5054283/gaza-school-shelter-deaths-israeli-airstrike).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there were Israeli airstrikes in Gaza in July 2024. The search results mention attacks on July 13 and July 27, 2024. The image search did not provide any information about the image.

The claim states that the image shows a Palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024. While the evidence confirms Israeli airstrikes in Gaza during July 2024, it does not confirm the image's context.

Therefore, I cannot verify the claim. More information is needed to confirm the image's context.


## Actions
```
image_search("Palestinian child rubble Gaza Israeli airstrike")
```

I still cannot verify the claim. More information is needed to confirm the image's context.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:59> This image shows a palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:59>)
web_search("Israeli airstrike Gaza July 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:59>

### Evidence from `web_search`
The Wikipedia article discusses the 13 July 2024 al-Mawasi attack in the Gaza Strip, where Israeli airstrikes killed at least 90 Palestinians and injured over 300. <image:59> The CNN article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir-al Balah, central Gaza, where at least 30 people were killed. <image:59> The NPR article, published on July 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli airstrike that hit a school being used as a shelter in Gaza, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including children. <image:12318>, <image:12319>

The articles can be found here: [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/13_July_2024_al-Mawasi_attack), [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/27/middleeast/israel-gaza-deir-al-balah-school-intl), [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/27/nx-s1-5054283/gaza-school-shelter-deaths-israeli-airstrike).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there were Israeli airstrikes in Gaza in July 2024. The search results mention attacks on July 13 and July 27, 2024. The image search did not provide any information about the image.

The claim states that the image shows a Palestinian child stuck under the rubble in Gaza after an Israeli airstrike in July 2024. While the evidence confirms Israeli airstrikes in Gaza during July 2024, it does not confirm the image's context.

Therefore, I cannot verify the claim. More information is needed to confirm the image's context.

```
image_search("Palestinian child rubble Gaza Israeli airstrike")
```

## Evidence

The search results include an article from Al Jazeera about the impact of the Israeli war on Gaza's children, featuring an image of children near rubble (<image:13961>

## Elaboration

I still cannot verify the claim. More information is needed to confirm the image's context.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealandâ€™s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```

image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

Breaking News

[Middle East](/z/598)

Syria, Russia Accuse US of Lying About Chemical Weapons Attacks
===============================================================

January 24, 2018 6:03 AM

*   By [Nike Ching](/author/nike-ching/kigmi "Nike Ching")
    

* * *

!A Syrian girl holds an oxygen mask over the face of an infant at a make-shift hospital following a reported gas attack on the rebel-held besieged town of Douma in the eastern Ghouta region on the outskirts of the capital Damascus on January 22, 2018.  <image:5756>

A Syrian girl holds an oxygen mask over the face of an infant at a make-shift hospital following a reported gas attack on the rebel-held besieged town of Douma in the eastern Ghouta region on the outskirts of the capital Damascus on January 22, 2018.

Â [](https://www.voanews.com)

Syria, Russia Accuse US of Lying About Chemical Weapons Attacks

Print

STATE DEPARTMENT â€”Â 

Syria and Russia on Wednesday accused the United States of lying about chemical weapons attacks in the Syrian conflict as a way of derailing efforts to bring an end to the fighting.

Syria's state-run SANA news agency carried comments from a Foreign Ministry source condemning what it called "lies and allegations" by U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson and French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian.

Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov told the Interfax news agency that whenever peace efforts advance, the United States promotes "rigged, unverified reports" of chemical weapons attacks in Syria.

Those comments came a day after the United States joined its NATO allies in launching a pressure campaign against the use of chemical weapons in Syria, while singling out Russia for protecting Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's government.

"The recent attacks in East Ghouta raise serious concerns that Bashar al-Assadâ€™s Syrian regime might be continuing its use of chemical weapons against its own people," Tillerson said at a Paris conference hosted by Le Drian.

Tillerson said at least 20 people were killed Monday in an apparent chlorine gas attack in rebel-held East Ghouta, near Damascus.  
  
"Whoever conducted the attacks, Russia ultimately bears responsibility for the victims in East Ghouta and countless other Syrians targeted with chemical weapons since Russia became involved in Syria," he said.

!A Syrian boy holds an oxygen mask over the face of an infant at a makeshift hospital following a reported gas attack on the rebel-held besieged town of Douma in the eastern Ghouta region on the outskirts of the capital Damascus, Jan. 22, 2018. <image:5757>

A Syrian boy holds an oxygen mask over the face of an infant at a makeshift hospital following a reported gas attack on the rebel-held besieged town of Douma in the eastern Ghouta region on the outskirts of the capital Damascus, Jan. 22, 2018.

Tillerson, along with foreign ministers from France, Germany and Turkey, were among those who launched the International Partnership Against Impunity for Use of Chemical Weapons on Tuesday. More than two dozen like-minded nations endorsed a political commitment to share information on combating the use of chemical weapons worldwide.

!U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson delivers a speech during a foreign ministers' meeting on the International Partnership against Impunity for the Use of Chemical Weapons, in Paris, Jan. 23, 2018. <image:5758>

U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson delivers a speech during a foreign ministers' meeting on the International Partnership against Impunity for the Use of Chemical Weapons, in Paris, Jan. 23, 2018.

The U.S. secretary of state noted Russia's failure to resolve the chemical weapons issue in Syria calls into question its commitment to the resolution of the overall crisis.

"At a very minimum, Russia must stop vetoing and at least abstain from future security council votes on this issue," Tillerson said.

In November, Russia vetoed the renewal of an independent and technical group created by the U.N. Security Council, the so-called Joint Investigative Mechanism (JIM), to look into the perpetrators of chemical weapons attacks in Syria.  
  
"When Russia killed the JIM, they sent a dangerous message to the world â€” one that not only said chemical weapons use is acceptable but also that those who use chemical weapons donâ€™t need to be identified or held accountable," U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley said in a statement Tuesday.  
  
**Concern about Turkey's Afrin offensive**  
  
Turkey's offensive in the northern Syrian enclave of Afrin was also a focus of Tuesday's talks in Paris, with Tillerson meeting with his Turkish counterpart, Mevlut Cavusoglu. A day earlier, during remarks in London, the top U.S. diplomat said the United States is "concerned" about the offensive against U.S.-backed Kurdish YPG fighters in Syria.

!Turkish army tanks enter Afrin, an enclave in northern Syria controlled by U.S.-allied Kurdish fighters, in Hassa, Hatay, Turkey, Jan. 22, 2018. <image:5759>

Turkish army tanks enter Afrin, an enclave in northern Syria controlled by U.S.-allied Kurdish fighters, in Hassa, Hatay, Turkey, Jan. 22, 2018.

  
Turkish forces intensified military operations on Monday to push the Kurdish militia out of the Afrin area.

The Turkish operation is aimed at ousting from Afrin the Syrian Kurdish group that has controlled territory in northern Syria and proven effective in the U.S.-coalition-led fight against Islamic State militants.

Turkey considers the YPG to be a terrorist organization associated with the outlawed Kurdistan Workers' Party or PKK, which has fought for Kurdish autonomy in Turkey.

French Foreign Minister Le Drian on Tuesday joined Tillerson in expressing his concern about Turkeyâ€™s military operation in Afrin.

"I had the opportunity to tell my Turkish colleague that this offensive worries us," Le Drian said.

!FILE - France's Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian listens during a news conference after his talks with Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov, in Moscow, Sept. 8, 2017. <image:5760>

FILE - France's Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian listens during a news conference after his talks with Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov, in Moscow, Sept. 8, 2017.

"While we understand the concerns Turkey has about border security, we cannot but call on Turkey to show the greatest level restraint on this issue," the French foreign minister added.

Turkey's shelling into Afrin came after the U.S.-led coalition said it would form a 30,000-strong Kurdish-led border security force in northern Syria.

Washington later said the effort had been mischaracterized and that the United States was not creating a border force, but that the coalition would provide security to liberated areas, blocking escape routes for Islamic State militants.

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:61> This image shows a Palestinian girl in the Gaza war in July 2024. She was holding her sister's oxygen mask inside the ambulance. She had already passed away, yet her hand remained on the mask firmly."

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.csis.org/analysis/emerging-trends-chemical-weapons-usage-middle-east): Found exact image on website with title: Emerging Trends in Chemical Weapons Usage in the Middle East
Content: "[Skip to main content](#main-content)

Emerging Trends in Chemical Weapons Usage in the Middle East
============================================================

     !Photo: JM LOPEZ/JM LOPEZ/AFP via Getty Images <image:5761>

Photo: JM LOPEZ/JM LOPEZ/AFP via Getty Images

Table of Contents
-----------------

Table of Contents
-----------------

*   [](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://www.csis.org/analysis/emerging-trends-chemical-weapons-usage-middle-east)
    
*   [](https://x.com/intent/post?url=https://www.csis.org/analysis/emerging-trends-chemical-weapons-usage-middle-east)
    
*   [](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https://www.csis.org/analysis/emerging-trends-chemical-weapons-usage-middle-east)
    
*   [](mailto:?subject=Page from CSIS.org&body=https://www.csis.org/analysis/emerging-trends-chemical-weapons-usage-middle-east)
